content.description: Super fun route, crux starts at the second crack above the broken section.  Strenuous climbing for 5-10 feet until some nice hand holds help you finish
content.protection: standard rack, medium to large pro   toprope from tree
content.location: 10 feet or so right from easy does it, follow cliff to left to find easy scramble down

content.description: Climb the crack on the left side of the dihedral for "easy does it".  The crux is before halfway up when you run out of feet and need solid crack technique.
content.protection: standard rack, medium pro.  Toprope from large tree on top (bring a long sling/runners)
content.location: Left side of dihedral for "easy does it", same top out

content.description: Climb the crack with good feet up until the overhang.  Fairly easy crux with bomber hands to a slopey topout.
content.protection: standard rack or toprope from tree anchor
content.location: Obvious crack 10 or 20 feet left from easy does it.  Scramble down just left from the top.

content.description: This climb follows straight up a diherdral crack using some face moves. The crux is a simple mantle at the bulge about a third of the way up. Afterwards, the climb moves up some slabby feet with cracks for hands.
content.protection: Standard rack. Cams to #2. Trees for top anchor.
content.location: Directly around the corner to the right of the standard Sorenson scramble.

content.description: This is the prominent feature that is Sorenson Point.
